page.title: 03EDUCATION IN STOCKSBRIDGE
page.content: IN STOCKSBRIDGE THERE ARE 5 SCHOOLS. THE NURSERY AND INFANT SCHOOL HAS A CAPACITY OF ABOUT 220 CHILDREN AND THE JUNIOR SCHOOL ON CEDAR ROAD 325 CHILDREN.BOLSTERSTONE CHURCH SCHOOL AND ST. ANN'S CATHOLIC SCHOOL ARE BOTH INFANT AND JUNIOR. THESE TOGETHER WITH DEEPCAR ST. JOHN'S CHURCH OF ENGLAND SCHOOL ALL FEED STOCKSBRIDGE COMPREHENSIVE ON SHAYHOUSE LANE. THE LATTER HAS 1100 PUPILS. THE COLLEGE OF EDUCATION ON MANCHESTER ROAD CONCENTRATES ON MECHANICAL ENGINEERING AND COMMERCIAL SUBJECTS FOR ADULTS, AND CERTAIN "A" LEVEL SUBJECTS FOR YOUNGER STUDENTS.
